revised_title: The Debate on the Julian and Gregorian Calendar Reform
tldr: In this article, Dr. John Wallis discusses the issues surrounding the proposed alteration of the Julian calendar to the Gregorian calendar. He expresses concerns about the potential confusion and disorder that could arise from such a change, particularly in the context of ecclesiastical and civil years. Wallis also highlights the historical and political implications of the calendar reform and argues for the superiority of the Julian year over the Gregorian year.
